sense.name: a moral responsibility or state of obligation
sense.examples: It is our duty to uphold the law. He instilled a strong sense of civic duty in his children. They have not done their duty as responsible citizens.

sense.name: required tasks, regular work demands
sense.examples: Writing the annual financial report is a main duty of the company's chief financial officer. He finished a second tour of duty in Iraq. She is stressed by all her new duties at work. The new nurse should report for duty at 6 am sharp. Appearing at the gala is one of the Queen's official duties.

sense.name: a government tax on imports/exports
sense.examples: The duties on this foreign sports car make it prohibitively expensive. There is no duty on any merchandise bought in these duty-free shops at the airport.

sense.name: a state of operational utility of a thing
sense.examples: We got double duty out of that trip to New York. 'making the word do the duty for the thing' (Edward Sapir) What is the duty cycle of this machine?
